title: Jean Paul de Gua de Malves
summary: Jean Paul de Gua de Malves (1713, Malves-en-Minervois (Aude) â€“ June 2, 1785, Paris[1]) was a French mathematician who published in 1740 a work on analytical geometry in which he applied it, without the aid of differential calculus, to find the tangents, asymptotes, and various singular points of an algebraic curve.
